title: Fossil Storage

properties.name: description
properties.value: Fossil Storage crates allow players to store fossils discovered on Fossil Island and retrieve them from any of the other Fossil Storage crates. There are five crates total, four of which are on Fossil Island, and one in the basement of the Varrock Museum.

content:
Fossil Storage
Released7 September 2017 (Update)
AKAFossil crate
MembersYes
QuestBone Voyage
LocationFossil Island, Varrock Museum
OptionsOpen
ExamineThis crate rocks.
Advanced data
Object ID30987, 30988

Fossil Storage crates allow players to store fossils discovered on Fossil Island and retrieve them from any of the other Fossil Storage crates. There are five crates total, four of which are on Fossil Island, and one in the basement of the Varrock Museum.

Contents

  • 1 Storage
  • 2 Locations
  • 3 Trivia
  • 4 See also

Storage[edit | edit source]

To use the fossil storage, players may click the box to open up the Fossil Storage window, where they can then deposit or withdraw fossils by clicking on them, and can choose to deposit or withdraw more than one, similar to a bank deposit box. For those with a bank PIN, it's required to input it before accessing, if players haven't done so already at a normal bank. Clean or uncleaned fossils can be added to any of the storage crates around Fossil Island as the contents of the storage crates are synchronised; this means fossils can be cleaned in the Museum Camp, stored in the storage crate and then collected from the storage crate in the basement of the Varrock Museum when they are ready to be added to exhibits, thus avoiding having to take multiple inventories back and forth between the camp and museum.

Locations[edit | edit source]

A fossil storage crate located at the Museum Camp.

There are five crates found on Fossil Island: one in the Museum Camp near the cleaning table, one next to the mycelium pool, one just inside the entrance to each Wyvern Cave, and one underwater next to Mairin. A sixth crate can be found next to the stairs in the basement section of the Varrock Museum, where the natural history quiz takes place.

Location Members Spawns Map
Museum Camp1Maplink
Mycelium pool1Maplink
Wyvern Cave2Maplink
Underwater1Maplink
Varrock Museum1Maplink

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Only 510 of each type of fossil stack can be stored in the crate, allowing a total of 2,805,000 prayer xp to be "banked" in the form of fossils before enriching them.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Bank deposit box

'''Fossil Storage''' crates allow players to store [[Fossil Island fossil|fossils]] discovered on [[Fossil Island]] and retrieve them from any of the other Fossil Storage crates. There are five crates total, four of which are on Fossil Island, and one in the basement of the [[Varrock Museum]].

==Storage==
[[File:Fossil Storage interface.png|left|frameless]]
To use the fossil storage, players may click the box to open up the Fossil Storage window, where they can then deposit or withdraw fossils by clicking on them, and can choose to deposit or withdraw more than one, similar to a [[Bank Deposit Box|bank deposit box]]. For those with a bank [[PIN]], it's required to input it before accessing, if players haven't done so already at a normal [[bank]].
Clean or uncleaned fossils can be added to any of the storage crates around Fossil Island as the contents of the storage crates are synchronised; this means fossils can be cleaned in the Museum Camp, stored in the storage crate and then collected from the storage crate in the basement of the Varrock Museum when they are ready to be added to exhibits, thus avoiding having to take multiple inventories back and forth between the camp and museum.

==Locations==
[[File:Museum Camp Fossil Storage.png|thumb|right|A fossil storage crate located at the Museum Camp.]]
There are five crates found on Fossil Island: one in the [[Museum Camp]] near the cleaning table, one next to the [[mycelium pool]], one just inside the entrance to each [[Wyvern Cave]], and one [[underwater]] next to [[Mairin]]. A sixth crate can be found next to the stairs in the basement section of the [[Varrock Museum]], where the [[natural history quiz]] takes place.

==Trivia==
* Only 510 of each type of fossil stack can be stored in the crate, allowing a total of 2,805,000 prayer xp to be "banked" in the form of fossils before [[Enriched bone|enriching]] them.
